cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico and 130 mi SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north through the Yucatan Channel, forecast to accelerate north-north-east across the eastern Gulf, make hurricane landfall along the NE Gulf Coast, then sweep NE across Georgia and the Carolinas before exiting into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle through inland Georgia and the southeast Atlantic coast (GA/SC/NC)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, gusts 50+ kt) possible late Wed night through Thu as Michael’s center moves NE across Georgia
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor Atlantic surge possible (<3 ft) as winds back onshore, but major surge not expected at Brunswick
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash flooding around Brunswick Thu
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible in outer rain bands on Thu
